title: Mean vs Median in Skewed Income
original_question: A community of 10 households has annual incomes (in $10k CAD): 4.5, 5.0, 5.2, 4.8, 6.0, 5.5, 4.9, 5.1, 5.8, 150.0. Calculate the mean and median. Explain why the median is more representative.

segments.explanation: A single extremely high value will inflate the mean significantly.

traps.title: The Average Fallacy
traps.description: Policy makers often use 'mean' to suggest high wealth, but the median better reflects the reality of a 'typical' person.

solution.content: The mean (19.68) is higher than 9 out of 10 households. The median (5.15) correctly centers the typical household experience.

title: Cross-Subject Performance (Z-Scores)
original_question: Xiao Ming scored 85 in Statistics (Mean 75, SD 10) and 80 in Economics (Mean 70, SD 4). In which subject did he perform better relative to his class?

segments.text: Xiao Ming scored 85 in Statistics (Mean 75, SD 10)
segments.explanation: Needed to convert raw score to relative standing (Z-score).
Needed to compare across different distributions.

traps.title: Raw Score Illusion
traps.description: Do not just compare 85 vs 80. A lower raw score in a harder test (low SD) can indicate higher relative excellence.

solution.content: Since $2.5 > 1.0$, Xiao Ming performed better in Economics relative to his peers.
